name: Village Birmingham Dudley

reviews.text: Stayed here for three night with the family whilst visiting Birmingham for the athletics championships.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: Had a lovely stay was nice to find out I was a member and receive a discount upon checkin.
reviews.title: Uncomfortable Stay

reviews.text: Pool facilities were great kids loved it although I think they could have just had two lanes blocked off as opposed to three. There wasn't much room for the children. Even if this was just during the family swim times.
reviews.title: Couldn't Have Been Happier

reviews.text: Victory pub food was lovely and it was also very handy for other restaurants on the industrial park opposite we walked over to nandos and there was also a cinema over there too.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay and would recommend village hotels and the facilities.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is pretty okay. The room is decent size with a decent size bathroom (with shower and bath). There is free WIFI in every room and in the meeting rooms. There is an iron board, tea/coffee facilities in the room (kettle and mugs etc) and TV. The bed is comfortable although its on wheels, so as soon as you sit up on the bed, it moves all over the room! The room comes with free use of the gym and pool, I only used the gym which was good and a wide selection of machines (both cardio and weights) and an okay free weight area.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast is okay too, you get all the English breakfast items as a buffet. Pretty good stuff for hotel food as it was not too greasy, I was actually surprised. There is also a small selection of croissants etc and cereals and a selection of fresh fruit and yogurts (including a decent smoothie).
reviews.title: Check what you have booked

reviews.text: I had tea at the Verve grill restaurant. The selection on the menu is pretty basic. The service was good (perhaps a little too formal for my liking), the food was standard (chips very dry, but the steak was very nice indeed and cooked perfectly).
reviews.title: Brill

reviews.text: It’s a very decent hotel, especially for business use (especially if you love stripes!)
reviews.title: Wonderful spa day!!!

reviews.text: I booked a room for me and my partner for a special occasion. I originally booked at wasall to only be told on the third phone call I made to them about booking my treatments that there was no spa their. Obviously very angry called to complain and they very kindly swapped us to Dudley however on arrival they only had us booked in for one night after booking two nights.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money and fabulous staff

reviews.text: I recently stayed here on business and was extremely disappointed. I normally stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Oldbury which is adequate however on this occasion, there were a group of 6 so we decided to stay here so we could use the gym and have a better restaurant. On checking in, I was handed a piece of plastic with a key hanging from a rubber band - not a great first start but a minor issue which I was happy to let go. I was on the second floor and the second I opened the door, I was hit with a stench of stale smoke. I put the key fob into the holder to get the lights on but to no avail - when i tried to remove it, it was jammed. On calling reception, they eventually wrenched it out with a screwdriver and jammed the switch so I could get lights. I was informed, "they're old and crap so sorry!" The room was OK but the furniture was badly stained with ring marks etc. I went to wash my hands to find the soap dispenser was jammed and wouldn't work. After a few minutes of pressing it, a dribble would eventually come out. The bed was comfortable enough but the air con didn't work so it was extremely hot and I couldnt open my window as it backed onto the back of Tesco delivery entrance so the noise was unbearable. I then found a dirty great handprint in the middle of the bedroom mirror. Dinner was very average - eggs benedict made with hard boiled eggs was a first and the ribs whilst edible, were not very good. The restaurant staff were pleasant and bubbly which was probably the best part of this hotel. The gym was exceptionally busy so be careful when you try to use these facilities - clearly open to non residents too. Breakfast was poor - a 10 minute wait to be seated, no milk with the tea/coffee, no fruit left and very few hot items out - this was at 7:45am! I later found out that one of my colleagues had no towels in her room - this she found out after showering. My shower was broken so only a trickle of water came out of the shower head while ost of it gushed down the wall. On a plus point - they did have a half decent hairdryer.
reviews.title: A big let down!

reviews.text: Overall this was a very disappointing visit. I have heard from others that this is the worst hotel in the chain so others may fair a bit better. I have booked the HIE for my next trip and will certainly not bother with this hotel again.
reviews.title: Slightly worried on arrival but had a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three days in June and when I booked it I thought it was a very nice hotel but on arrival I started to get a little nervous, the key they gave us was broken, the toiletries are the cheap dispensers you usually get at Premier Lodges and the decorating has seen better days but luckily from here on everything just got better, the staff were great and we had dinner in the restaurant which was both tasty and affordable, the on site Starbucks was also a plus. Breakfast could have been better but had some awesome pastries that made up for any other let downs.
reviews.title: Amazing Property in Dudley

reviews.text: The jewel in the crown however is definitely the leisure facilities which I used on every day of our stay, the gym was great with ample machines that were well maintained and spaced, definitely the kind of gym I would join rather than the usual hotel side room that often passes for a gym. The pool was large and we'll set out with a big pool, steam room and sauna but if you don't have kids with you I would try to stick to 12 -14 or before 10 which are adult only as otherwise it gets s little crowded.
reviews.title: Good Service Poor Standards

reviews.text: In all the only real negative we had was that the room was far too hot and the air conditioner didn't work, but I am sure if I had complained they would have sorted something out, but as I am English I didn't complain so I guess it was mostly my fault.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.text: Booked a table of 10 for my friends party in the restaurant, we were all looked after exceptionally well, many thanks to Darryl the Manager who kindly gave us two bottles of bubbly on the table.
reviews.title: 70th birthday party friday 21 June 13

reviews.text: We all dined off the two people for 3 courses menu for £29 excellent value and well presented meals, not one complaint
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this for anyone celebrating a night out
reviews.title: Good Weekend Stay

reviews.text: This is a good clean hotel. Rooms arw good size and well equipped with flat screen tvs and tea making facilities.
reviews.title: Seemed under staffed.......

reviews.text: Gym and lesuire areas are good and friendly places.
reviews.title: Spa day

description: Village Urban Resort Dudley where business and leisure combine effortlessly.
